an5.103:1.1: “Mendicants, a master thief with five factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.
an5.103:1.3: A master thief relies on rough ground, on thick cover, and on the powerful; they pay bribes, and they act alone.
an5.103:2.1: And how does a master thief rely on rough ground?
an5.103:2.2: It’s when a master thief relies on inaccessible riverlands or rugged mountains.
an5.103:2.3: That’s how a master thief relies on rough ground.
an5.103:3.1: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?
an5.103:3.2: It’s when a master thief relies on thick grass, thick trees, a blind spot, or a large forest grove.
an5.103:3.3: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.
an5.103:4.1: And how does a master thief rely on the powerful?
an5.103:4.2: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their chief ministers.
an5.103:4.4: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their chief ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’
an5.103:4.6: That’s how a master thief relies on the powerful.
an5.103:5.1: And how does a master thief pay bribes?
an5.103:5.2: It’s when a master thief is rich, affluent, and wealthy.
an5.103:5.4: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, I’ll settle it with a bribe.’
an5.103:5.6: That’s how a master thief pays bribes.
an5.103:6.1: And how does a master thief act alone?
an5.103:6.2: It’s when a master thief carries out robbery all alone.
an5.103:6.4: So that their secret plans are not leaked to others.
an5.103:6.5: That’s how a master thief acts alone.
an5.103:7.1: A master thief with these five factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.
an5.103:8.1: In the same way, when a bad mendicant has five qualities, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.
an5.103:8.3: A bad mendicant relies on rough ground, on thick cover, and on the powerful; they pay bribes, and they act alone.
an5.103:9.1: And how does a bad mendicant rely on rough ground?
an5.103:9.2: It’s when a bad mendicant has unethical conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
an5.103:9.3: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on rough ground.
an5.103:10.1: And how does a bad mendicant rely on thick cover?
an5.103:10.2: It’s when a bad mendicant has wrong view, he’s attached to an extremist view.
an5.103:10.3: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on thick cover.
an5.103:11.1: And how does a bad mendicant rely on the powerful?
an5.103:11.2: It’s when a bad mendicant relies on rulers or their chief ministers.
an5.103:11.4: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their chief ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’
an5.103:11.6: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on the powerful.
an5.103:12.1: And how does a bad mendicant pay bribes?
an5.103:12.2: It’s when a bad mendicant receives robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.103:12.4: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, I’ll settle it with a bribe.’
an5.103:12.6: That’s how a bad mendicant pays bribes.
an5.103:13.1: And how does a bad mendicant act alone?
an5.103:13.2: It’s when a bad mendicant dwells alone in the borderlands.
an5.103:13.3: They visit families there to acquire material things.
an5.103:13.4: That’s how a bad mendicant acts alone.
an5.103:14.1: When a bad mendicant possesses these five qualities, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they create much wickedness.”
